intro: Bumelia hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras bumelia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Bumelia hondurensis is typically found in dry forests and scrublands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
